END-USER TERMS OF USE

MONSENSO ApS

Version 1.0.2, 22. January 2018

END-USER TERMS OF USE (“TERMS”) FOR MONSENSO SMARTPHONE APPLICATION ('MONSENSO APPS') AND MONSENSO WEB SERVICES ('MONSENSO WEB SERVICES'), in collection 'MONSENSO SERVICES'

Please read this document carefully prior to using the Monsenso Services.

For information about collection, processing and use of Personal Data, please see the Privacy Policy.

The Monsenso Services are for authorised use only. Unauthorised access or activity might be a violation of law. Monsenso has the ability and reserves the right to monitor the use of Monsenso Services in accordance with applicable law for purposes of security and ensuring compliance with law and the company's policies regarding the use of its computer systems.

The Monsenso Services are a medical device (as defined in Art. 1 of the EU Directive 93/42/EEC concerning Medical Devices). The Monsenso Services are not intended to replace the professional judgment of the caring physician, pharmacist or other qualified healthcare professional and is for general guidance purposes only. It is the ultimate decision of a healthcare professional to decide, which treatment is necessary and appropriate.

Should a user experience adverse events attributed to the use of the Monsenso Services this must be reported and Monsenso must be informed at support@monsenso.com

By downloading, installing, or using the Monsenso Services, you accept these terms. If you do not accept them, do not download, install or use the Monsenso Services.

You acknowledge and agree that (i) your use of the Monsenso Services or any services performed by or accessed through the Monsenso Services is entirely at your own risk; (ii) The use of the Monsenso Services does not create a physician-patient relationship between an individual and Monsenso; (iii) The Monsenso Services does not constitute or provide any medical diagnosis, treatment or advice; (iv) as an individual, you will consult with you physician before undertaking any medication; and (v) to the maximum extent permitted under applicable law, neither Monsenso nor its affiliated companies shall be liable for any loss, damage, or physical or mental injury that may result from your use of the Monsenso Services or third party content.

By using the Monsenso Services, you expressly manifest your agreement to the following Monsenso End-User Terms of Use.

In these Terms, “Service Provider” means Monsenso ApS, the entity that is licensing the Monsenso Services to you. Monsenso is solely responsible for the Monsenso Services. If the Monsenso Services enables access to any Internet-based services, your use of those services will be subject to the separately-provided terms of use of such services. In these Terms, Apple, Google, Microsoft, and any of their subsidiaries are the “Phone Provider”. You acknowledge and agree that any Phone Provider are third party beneficiaries of the Agreement, and that upon your acceptance of the Terms, the Phone Provider will have the right (and will be deemed to have accepted the right) to enforce the Terms against you as a third party beneficiary thereof.

1. INSTALLATION AND USE

a. You affirm, represent, and/or warrant that: (i) you are at least 18 years old; (ii) if you are acting on behalf of a legal entity, you have legal authority and entitlement to bind the entity to these Terms (and in which case “you” shall mean such legal entity).

b. You may download, install and use the Application in accordance with these Terms. You may install and use the Monsenso Apps on mobile devices you personally own or control and which are affiliated with the Phone Provider ID associated with your Phone Provider Marketplace account. You may not install or use a copy of the Monsenso Apps on a device you do not own or control.

c. You acknowledge that your use of the Monsenso Services creates data traffic.

d. You acknowledge that the Service Provider may change the functionality and features of the Monsenso Services from time to time without notice to you.

e. Installation and use of the Monsenso Services requires a user registration with the Service Provider.

f. The Service Provider may introduce functionality or features developed and produced by third Parties into the Monsenso Services in the purpose to provide you additional functionality and features. You may agree to the Third-Party terms and conditions when using this functionality or feature. As a third party to this contract, the Service Provider is not liable for any use and direct or indirect consequence attached to the use of such functionality or feature.

2. INTERNET-BASED SERVICES

a. Your use of the Monsenso Services requires the use of internet-based services provided by the Service Provider, its suppliers, and/or your wireless carrier. In addition to the following, your use of such services is subject to the terms provided to you by the Service Provider and/or your Internet provider and/or wireless carrier, with which you agree to comply.

b. The Monsenso Services will connect to computer systems over an internet-based wireless network. You will not receive a separate notice when they connect. Using the Monsenso Services operates as your consent to the transmission of your information (including but not limited to technical information about your device, system software, application software on the phone, the Monsenso Services software, sensors and peripherals, as well as any data you submit in regard to your use of the Monsenso Services) via internet-based or wireless services.

c. Your information is processed in Denmark or in another European Community Member State, and the processing is governed by Directive 95/46/EC on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of data and on the free movement of such data. As of 25 May 2018 the General Data Protection Regulation (EU Directive 2016/679 of April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data) (the “GDPR”) will replace Directive 95/46/EC, and Monsenso shall comply with the GDPR from then onwards.

d. Your information may be transmitted in any country in which the Monsenso Service Provider, its suppliers, or your fixed or wireless carrier maintain facilities.

Personal data (hereinafter “Personal Data”) shall be considered as any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person. Personal Data includes, but is not limited to, your username, password, email address, social security number, name, address, self-reported medical data, medication, patient-clinician communication, and any data entered into the Monsenso Services. In addition, the Monsenso Services collect and store certain information automatically, such as the type of mobile device you use, your mobile operating system, your use of the mobile phone, your use of applications on the mobile phone, location data, sensor data, voice data, and information about the way you use the Monsenso Services. The Service Provider may use statistical data, trends, data analysis and usage information derived from your information and your use of the Monsenso Services for the purpose of providing, operating, maintaining and/or improving the functionality of the Monsenso Services.

e. Monsenso may disclose user-provided and automatically collected information: (a) as required by law; (b) when it is believed, in good faith, that disclosure is necessary to protect our rights, protect your safety or the safety of others, investigate fraud, or respond to a public authority request; and (c) to our suppliers who work on our behalf.

3. SCOPE OF LICENCE

a. The Monsenso Services are licensed, not sold. These Terms only give you rights to use the Monsenso Services. The Service Provider reserves all other rights. Unless applicable law gives you more rights despite this limitation, you may use the Monsenso Services only as expressly permitted in these Terms and as permitted by the usage rules set forth in the Phone Provider Terms of Service. In doing so, you must comply with any technical limitations in the Monsenso Services that only allow you to use it in certain ways.

You may not:

1. use the Monsenso Services in a way that is prohibited by any law, regulation or governmental order or decree in any relevant jurisdiction, or that violates others’ legal rights;

2. use the Monsenso Services in a way that would subject the Service Provider, its suppliers, or your fixed or wireless carrier to obligations or liabilities under laws or regulations that would not otherwise apply to the Monsenso Services;

3. use the Monsenso Services in any way designed to or to attempt to introduce a virus or malware to the network or devices on the network; send unsolicited bulk or commercial messages; or create a denial of service attack;

4. work around any technical limitations in the Monsenso Services;

5. reverse engineer, decompile or disassemble the Monsenso Services;

6. make more copies of the Monsenso Services than specified in this Agreement or allowed by applicable law, despite this limitation;

7. publish or otherwise make the Monsenso Services available for others to copy;

8. rent, lease or lend the Monsenso Services; or

9. transfer the Monsenso Services or this Agreement to any third party.

4. DOCUMENTATION

a. If documentation is provided with the Monsenso Services, you may copy and use the documentation for your internal reference purposes.

5. CHANGES TO THE SERVICES

a. At its convenience and without prior notice, the Service Provider may modify, add or delete functions of the Service or the Product.

6. CHANGES TO THE SERVICE'S TERMS OF USE

a. The Service Provider reserves the right to modify all or part of these Terms without notice. Use of the Monsenso Services by you constitutes full and complete acceptance of any changes made to the present Terms. However, you will be informed of such changes by a notice on the Monsenso Services. You will be asked to agree to the changes before entering the site on the date of notice.

7. NO WARRANTIES OR LIABILITY

a. Unless required by legislation on Medical Devices or any mandatory legal provision, the Monsenso Services are provided on an “AS IS” and “AS AVAILABLE” basis.

b. Monsenso makes, and user receives, in connection with the Monsenso Services no other warranty, express or implied, including without limitation, the implied warranties of merchantability, of fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement. Monsenso does not promise that the elements, or any content service or feature of them, including any information and documents downloaded by you are free of error or defects, or that the aforementioned will be corrected. To the maximum extent permitted under applicable law, Monsenso disclaims any and all liability for any damage directly or indirectly suffered by you, in connection with or related to your use of any Monsenso Service. You must assume total responsibility for your use of the Monsenso Services. Your sole remedy against Monsenso for any dissatisfaction or deception with all or part of the Monsenso services or any content directly or indirectly linked to it is to stop using the Monsenso services. This limitation of relief is an essential part of the bargain between the parties without which the parties would not have entered into an agreement.

c. To the maximum permitted under applicable law, you expressly acknowledge and accept that the Service Provider; (i) may temporarily or occasionally interrupt the Monsenso Services in order to perform maintenance or update operations, without this in any way making the Service Provider liable; (ii) may in no case be held liable for any damage whatsoever, whether caused directly or indirectly by its services; (iii) may in no case be held liable for damage to and losses of data suffered by you. It is therefore up to you to take all appropriate measures to protect your own data or software from the contamination of your hardware by any viruses circulating on the Internet.

8. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS

a. All texts, photos, logos, trademarks and other elements reproduced on the Monsenso Services (Monsenso Apps and Monsenso Web Services) are reserved and protected by copyright, for the entire world.

b. The User, or a third party, is prohibited from reproducing, representing, distributing, marketing, modifying, utilising or assigning all or part of any of the elements reproduced on the site without the Service Provider's prior consent.

c. To the extent that you communicate to the Service Provider any ideas or suggestions for modifications, extensions, or improvements to the Monsenso Services, or any other Service Provider product or service (“Your Feedback”), you hereby grant the Service Provider and its affiliates, under all intellectual property rights (including patent and copyright) you have in Your Feedback, a non-exclusive, worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free, sub licensable and fully transferable license to (i) create derivative works using Your Feedback, (ii) make, have made, use, sell, lease, offer for sale, export, and otherwise dispose of products or services using Your Feedback (and derivative works thereof), (iii) copy, publicly perform, display, import, broadcast, transmit, distribute, license, offer to sell, sell, rent, lease or lend Your Feedback (and derivative works thereof).

d. Any unlawful use of all or part of the Monsenso Services may give rise to criminal prosecution.

9. APPLICABLE LAW

a. In the event of any controversy or dispute between Monsenso and You arising out of or in connection with your use of any Monsenso Services, the parties shall attempt, promptly, in good faith and before any judicial action, to resolve the dispute though alternative dispute resolution.

b. Unless otherwise required by applicable law, these Monsenso End-User Terms of Use and any matters relating to them, including all disputes, will be governed by the laws of Denmark and be settled in the courts of Copenhagen (Denmark) or, if you are a consumer the courts of the country where you reside.

c. The Parties may agree to resolve their dispute in accordance with Directive 2013/11/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of the 21 May 2013 on alternative dispute resolution for consumer disputes and the Regulation (EU) No 524/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 May 2013 online dispute resolution for consumer disputes.

If you complain about Monsenso Services, you may submit a complaint to “Center for Klageløsning I Konkurrence- og Forbrugerstyrelsen, Carl Jacobsens Vej 35, 2500 Valby. You may complain to Center for Klageløsning via www.forbrug.dk.

You may also use the EU-Commission Online Dispute Resolution for submission of a complaint. This is relevant in particular, if you are a consumer with residence in another EU country. The complaint may be submitted to http://ec.europa.eu/odr.

10. TERMINATION

a. The Service Provider may without notice terminate these Terms and the license granted hereunder, if you materially breach any of the terms or conditions herein. If these Terms terminate, all rights granted to you by this agreement will automatically terminate and you will cease to have any rights to use the Monsenso Services.
